info.title: WP Global CNP Payment API
info.description:
Request Payload Validation Testing endpoints

Functional Goals: 
   •  Clean API surface area following standard REST conventions
                                    
   •  Thin mapping layer over an integration to WPG's XML-RPC webAPI for US and Intl Merchants
                                    
   •  Logically strutured Request and Response objects
                                    
   •  Support of Idempotency (via a HTTP Header)
                                    
   •  Ability to easily adding new payment methods via a polymorphic PaymentMethod property
                                    
   •  Ability to easily adding new industry specific data via a polymorphic IndustryData property
                                    
   •  Developer friendly Request Data Validation error responses
                                    
   •  Support for "Referenced" follow on transactions
                                    
   •  Baked in support for Sync responses (indicated by a HTTP 200 return code) and Async responses (indicated by a HTTP 202 return code).
                                    
   •  Error responses returned in RFC7807 ProblemDetails compliant responses
                                    
   •  High Fidelity OpenAPI v3 file (incl oneOf and type descriminators for polymorphic properties)
                                    
 
                            

                                
                                    

                                        Date
                                        Version
                                        Changes
                                    

                                
                                
                                    

                                        2022/04/15
                                        v1.0
                                         Alpha implementation

post.description: You want to process an Authorization and Capture in one (1) step.

parameters.name: wp-idempotencyKey
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the message with a maximum of 64 characters (we recommend a UUID).

parameters.name: wp-correlationId
parameters.description: A identifier used to trace a request thru multiple internal platforms.  This would not be exposed to external callers (we recommend a UUID).

value.title: Unprocessable Entity
value.detail: One of more errors occured trying to validate the request object

PaymentMethod.CardNumber: 'Card Number' must be between 12 and 24 characters. You entered 27 characters.
PaymentMethod.ExpiryMonth: 'Expiry Month' must be between 1 and 12. You entered 13.
PaymentMethod.ExpiryYear: 'Expiry Year' [2035] is typically not more the 5 years after being issued.
PaymentMethod.BillingAddress.CountryCode: 'Country Code' [US] Please supply a ISO 3166 (alpha-3) 3 character country code.

post.description: You want to complete the authorization and initiate funds movement using the reference from your original request.

parameters.name: wpTransactionId
parameters.description: A unique identifier returned from the original transaction for the payment that you want to capture.

parameters.name: wp-idempotencyKey
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the message with a maximum of 64 characters (we recommend a UUID).

parameters.name: wp-correlationId
parameters.description: A identifier used to trace a request thru multiple internal platforms.  This would not be exposed to external callers (we recommend a UUID).

post.description: You can refund either the full captured amount or a part of the captured amount. You can also perform multiple partial refunds, as long as their sum doesn't exceed the captured amount.

post.description:
This will either: 
Cancel the payment  in case it has not yet been captured. 
Refund the payment  in case it has already been captured.

parameters.name: wpTransactionId
parameters.description: A unique identifier returned from the original transaction for the payment that you want to reverse.

parameters.name: wp-idempotencyKey
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the message with a maximum of 64 characters (we recommend a UUID).

CurrencyCode.title: CurrencyCode
CurrencyCode.description:
The three-character ISO 4217 currency code.

Undefined

CAD (Canadian Dollar [2 Decimal places implied, enter 1.23 as 123])

EUR (Euro [2 Decimal places implied, enter 1.23 as 123])

GBP (Pound Sterling [2 Decimal places implied, enter 1.23 as 123])

USD (US Dollar [2 Decimal places implied, enter 1.23 as 123])

CustomerInteractionType.title: CustomerInteractionType
CustomerInteractionType.description:
ECOMMERCE (For transactions through your website (default))

MOTO (For mail or telephone orders)

ResultCode.title: ResultCode
ResultCode.description:
Undefined (Undefined)

Authorized (The payment was successfully authorised. This is a final state.)

stateOrProvince.description: The two-character ISO 3166-2 state or province code.

postalCode.description: The Postal Code associated with the address

airlineCode.description: IATA 3 digit code that identifies the carrier

tripLegs.description: Information about each leg of the flight

value.description: The amount of money, in the smallest denomination of the currency indicated by CurrencyCode.

fisDiscountedAmount.description: The actual discounted amounted returned to the terminal so the customer can determine whether to opt in/out.

FisLoyaltyEligibility.description: True/False flag indicating the merchant's ability to accept Loyalty transactions.

fisLoyaltyOptIn.description: True/False flag on the follow-up message to indicate whether or not the customer accepts the discounted amount.

fisLoyaltyTransactionID.description: The FIS transaction ID that ties requests together. It should be sent on any follow-up messages.

fisLoyaltyRewardID.description: This field contains the reward ID associated with the transaction.

fisLoyaltyPromoID.description: This field contains the loyalty program associated with the transaction

fisLoyaltySequenceNumber.description: This field contains the loyalty sequence number that must be submitted on subsequent loyalty transactions

fisLoyaltyReservationID.description: This contains the reservation ID used with the loyalty system to reserve/finalize e-comm Premium Payback tranasactions.

fisLoyaltyPSPID.description: This contains the PSP identifier associated with the processor who holds the loyalty reservation. It will be ignored without a Loyalty Reservation ID.

swiftCode.description:
The BIC/Swift code of the shoppers bank. This can be either:
 - A valid BIC (Business Identifier Code)
 - Null
